event.title: stood in a corner of Linplum farm, to this day

data.event: This was once a separate community and parish, with its own church and graveyard which stood in a corner of Linplum farm, to this day called kirk field.

event.title: 1743 part of the roof of the ancient church collapsed

data.event: In 1743 part of the roof of the ancient church collapsed.
The Glebe was on the north side of the road leading to Garvald and the manse stood where, in 1890, the Bara blacksmith's premises stood.
